API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.1

sandy.materials.attributes.PhongAttributes

type
class
extends
ALightAttributes
version
3.1
Realize a Phong shading on a material.

In true Phong shading, normals are supposed to be interpolated across the surface; here scaled normal projections are interpolated in the light map space. The downside of this method is that in case of low poly models interpolation results are inaccurate - in this case you can improve the result using GouraudAttributes for ambient and diffuse, and then this attribute for specular reflection.

Constructor

new()
parameters
p_bBright The brightness (value for useBright).
p_bBright The brightness (value for useBright).
p_nAmbient The ambient light value. A value between 0 and 1 is expected.
p_nQuality Quality of light response approximation. A value between 2 and 15 is expected.
p_nSamples A number of calculated samples per anchor. Positive value is expected.
Create the PhongAttributes object.

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

ambient(__getAmbient,__setAmbient) : Float

inherited from sandy.materials.attributes.ALightAttributes
Ambient reflection factor.

Note that since geometry of sprites is unknown, this is going to be the only lighting setting affecting them, so you would typically need to set it to bigger value than you would for shapes.

inherited from sandy.materials.attributes.ALightAttributes
Method called before the display list rendering. This is the common place for this attribute to precompute things

computeLightMap(default,method) : p_oLight : sandy.core.light.Light3D -> ?p_nQuality : Int -> ?p_nSamples : Int -> Void

Compute the light map.

Normally you should not need to call this function, as it is done for you automatically when it is needed. You might call it to compute light map in advance, though.

inherited from sandy.materials.attributes.ALightAttributes
Allows to proceed to an initialization to know when the polyon isn't lined to the material, look at #unlink

onlySpecular : Bool

Flag for rendering mode.

If true, only specular highlight is rendered, when useBright is also true.
If false (the default) ambient and diffuse reflections will also be rendered.

specular(__getSpecular,__setSpecular) : Float

inherited from sandy.materials.attributes.ALightAttributes
Specular reflection factor.

spherize : Float

Non-zero value adds sphere normals to actual normals for light rendering. Use this with flat surfaces or cylinders.

unlink(default,method) : p_oPolygon : sandy.core.data.Polygon -> Void

inherited from sandy.materials.attributes.ALightAttributes
Remove all the initialization opposite of init

useBright(__getUseBright,__setUseBright) : Bool

Flag for lightening mode.

If true (the default), the lit objects use full light range from black to white.
If false they just range from black to their normal appearance; additionally, current implementation does not render specular reflection in this case.
